Macros
DPM Commands
DPM API

The section has a list of all commands which are supported by the DPM framework These commands are always available and can be used irrespective of the DPC. More...

Macros

#define DPM_CMD_INJECT_DATA   1
 This is the command which can be used by the application to notify the processing chain that buffers are available to be processed. arg = &DPM_Buffer argLen = sizeof (DPM_Buffer) This will only notify the local processing chain and will not relay the request to the remote or distributed domain. More...
 
#define DPM_CMD_BSS_FAULT   2
 This is the command which can be used by the application to inform the module that there was a CPU/ESM fault reported by the mmWave link layer. This is passed to the processing chain to take appropriate action. arg = NULL argLen = 0.
 
#define DPM_CMD_DPC_ASSERT   3
 This is the command which can be used by the processing chain to inform the application about a fault/exception which the chain encountered. The application is notified about the assertion via the reporting API. arg = &assert argLen = sizeof (DPM_DPCAssert) More...
 
#define DPM_CMD_DPC_INFO   4
 This is a generic command which can be used by the processing chain to send any custom information to the application. The payload is not interpreted by the framework and is passed to the application via the reporting mechanism arg = &info argLen <= sizeof(DPM_DPCInfo) More...
 
#define DPM_CMD_DPC_START_INDEX   100
 Processing chain specific command start index: Command Index before this are reserved for use by the core Module. All processing chains should use this as a starting index for their own custom commmands.
 

Detailed Description

The section has a list of all commands which are supported by the DPM framework These commands are always available and can be used irrespective of the DPC.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define DPM_CMD_DPC_ASSERT   3

This is the command which can be used by the processing chain to inform the application about a fault/exception which the chain encountered. The application is notified about the assertion via the reporting API. arg = &assert argLen = sizeof (DPM_DPCAssert)

See also
DPM_Report_DPC_ASSERT
#define DPM_CMD_DPC_INFO   4

This is a generic command which can be used by the processing chain to send any custom information to the application. The payload is not interpreted by the framework and is passed to the application via the reporting mechanism arg = &info argLen <= sizeof(DPM_DPCInfo)

See also
DPM_Report_DPC_INFO
#define DPM_CMD_INJECT_DATA   1

This is the command which can be used by the application to notify the processing chain that buffers are available to be processed. arg = &DPM_Buffer argLen = sizeof (DPM_Buffer) This will only notify the local processing chain and will not relay the request to the remote or distributed domain.

NOTE: Please refer to the DPC documentation on the exact format of data which is to be passed.
